text.p: Apple Computer Inc said Saturday it has reduced prices to resellers on select Power Macintosh 6500 and Macintosh Performa 6400 series computers by up to $300.
Apple, which was rocked by the departure of Chairman Gilbert Amelio on Tuesday, said the price cuts aim to provide users with powerful and easy-to-use computers at competitive prices.

It said that the price of a 6500 Series has been reduced to $2,800 from $3,000; the 6500/300 to $2,800 from $3,000; the 6500/275 Creative Studio to $2,800 from $3,000; the 6500/250 Small Business to $2,300 from $2,600; the Power 6500/250 to $2,000 from $2,300; the 6500/225 to $1,800 from $2,000; the Performa 6400/200 Video Editing Edition to $1,800 from $2,100; the Performa 6400/200MHz with Home Solution Bundle to $1,500 from $1,800 and the Performa 6400/200MHz to $1,400 from $1,700.
Actual U.S. prices may vary and customers should consult their local Apple authorized reseller, it said.
